definition: to recommend oneself (for a job)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to recommend/to offer sacrifice (arch.)/grass/straw mat
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)

sentences.english: I fully expected one of the women to volunteer6, as was usually the case.
sentences.chinese: 我滿心指望像平常一樣，某位女士能毛遂自薦。

sentences.english: Do you shrink from doing anything that smacks of self-promotion?
sentences.chinese: 帶有自薦意味的事情會讓你退縮嗎？

sentences.english: He offers up his services to finish the operation.
sentences.chinese: 他毛遂自薦來完成這個行動計劃。

sentences.english: Applicants whose personal statements are submitted in both Korean and English receive precedent.
sentences.chinese: 曾有申請學生遞交過韓英雙語之自薦個人陳述的先例。

sentences.english: Thank you to take time to browse me to recommend letter in 100 favours first.
sentences.chinese: 起首感激您在百忙之中抽暇閱讀本人地自薦信。

sentences.english: Ask if you can help be a source for other stories.
sentences.chinese: 如果其它報道你能提供新聞線索，不妨自薦。

sentences.english: Li Yugang proposed to the boss that he could finish the show for her.
sentences.chinese: 李玉剛向他的老闆自薦說他可以完成女聲部分。

sentences.english: Thank you for opening up the introductory letter which read me in the midst of pressing affairs.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您在百忙之中展閱我的自薦信。

sentences.english: Extremely thank you in to be very busy can scrutinize me to offer to volunteer the book.
sentences.chinese: 十分感激您在百忙中能核閱本人的自薦書。

sentences.english: Finally, thank you to scrutinize me once more to offer to volunteer the material.
sentences.chinese: 最後，再次感激您核閱本人的自薦資料。

sentences.english: A cover letter typically accompanies each resume you send out.
sentences.chinese: 每封自薦信都是隨着簡歷一起寄出的。

sentences.english: We have the pleasure of introducing ourselves to your as a state-operated corporation dealing exclusively in light industrial goods.
sentences.chinese: 我們有幸自薦，我們是一家專營輕工業品的有限公司。

sentences.english: Thank you in 100 favours the exhibition read I recommend the letter.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您在百忙之中展閱我的自薦信。
採用標準的自薦信格式。

sentences.english: It is unadvisable to put yourself up for the chairman's seat.
sentences.chinese: 你自薦當選主席是不明智的。

sentences.english: This might have been established because of the excellence of your CV and covering letter.
sentences.chinese: 對方可能是根據你的簡歷及自薦書確定你的能力。

definition: to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to recommend sb/to give a referral
to take the opportunity/to take a plane
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name
conspiracy/secret plan/to conspire
to agree (to do sth)/to promise
to fight in one place after another
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
visitor/guest/object (in grammar)
to sneer at sb/to ridicule
to pull strings/to manipulate (a puppet)/to control from behind the scene/to mediate
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
